abstracts.cdata!:
The Sichuan Urban Environment Project
            (SUEP) plans to enable sustainable environmental growth in
            Sichuan province through water supply improvement, water
            pollution control, and solid waste services for five cities
            in Sichuan (Chengdu, Leshan, Deyang, Zigong, and Luzhou).
            The resettlement action plan deals with all of the cities,
            noting that the number and type of population affected
            varies, from a single household (Leshan water supply site)
            to 340 (Chengdu), and comprised of both farmers and
            shopkeepers. Mitigation measures ensured by the Land Bureau
            include: a) proper arrangements for the relocation of
            residents as well as for finding them jobs with similar
            levels of skill and pay; b) minimum destruction of buildings
            while avoiding delays in construction to minimize land left
            idle; c) dissemination of resettlement information among
            affected populations and propaganda to encourage project
            support; d) within the limits of resettlement policies,
            requirements of relocated people are met as far as possible;
            e) support is given for relocatees to build houses in new
            areas with building materials provided at a preferential
            prices; and f) no delay in compensation payments.
